channel.title: Clean Power Plan
channel.description: Updated Clean Power Plan content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Clean Power Plan Petitions for Reconsideration January 2017
item.description:
January 11, 2017 – Following a process outlined in the Clean Air Act and after careful review, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is denying most of the petitions for reconsideration and all of the petitions for administrative stay the agency received on the Clean Power Plan. Over the past year, EPA considered the variety of technical and legal issues that petitioners raised and has determined that the petitions failed to satisfy one or both of the legal conditions necessary to grant reconsideration.

  • Notice: Denial of Reconsideration and Administrative Stay of the Clean Power Plan (PDF) (3 pp, 198 K, About PDF) - Federal Register - January 17, 2017 
  • Basis for Denial of Petitions to Reconsider and Petitions to Stay the Clean Power Plan (PDF)(266 pp, 2 MB)
  • Appendix 1 — States’ Progress and Trends (PDF)(26 pp, 327 K)
  • Appendix 2 — Power Sector Trends (PDF)(82 pp, 1 MB)
  • Appendix 3 — Non-BSER CPP Flexibilities (PDF)(26 pp, 1 MB)
  • Appendix 4 — Climate Science Update (PDF)(6 pp, 55 K)
item.dc:creator: jashley

item.title: CEIP Webinars - October 2016
item.description:
Two Webinars on the Clean Power Plan's Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP) for Communities with EJ Concerns

The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) will host two webinars for communities with environmental justice concerns and environmental justice organizations on the Clean Air Act (CAA) and how it addresses pollution from electric generating units (EGUs). These webinars will also discuss how the Clean Power Plan?s Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP) fits into the framework of the CAA. The CEIP, which was included in the final Clean Power Plan, is designed to help states meet their goals under the plan by encouraging early investments in zero-emitting renewable energy generation, and by removing barriers to investment in energy efficiency and solar measures in low-income communities.

This is an opportunity for stakeholders to learn about several key design elements of the CEIP that were recently proposed. These elements include: clarifications about project eligibility, providing states with the flexibility to choose a definition of a low-income community, and how the pool of matching allowances and emission rate credits (ERCs) should be made available. During these webinars, participants will have an opportunity to engage in an open dialogue with EPA staff and other stakeholders.

Additional information on the Clean Energy Incentive Program and Clean Power Plan can be found at: https://www.epa.gov/cleanpowerplan/clean-energy-incentive-program and https://www.epa.gov/cleanpowerplan.

For questions about the webinars, please contact Lena Vickey Epps-Price at epps-price.lena@epa.gov; 919-541-5573.

Webinar Details:

Please click on the meeting link 10 minutes before the webinars start to ensure your participation. Audio for the webinars will be delivered through the phone line.

  • Date: Tuesday, October 11, 2016
  • Time: 1:00 - 2:30 p.m. EST
  • URL: http://epawebconferencing.acms.com/ceip/
  • Participant Dial-in Number: (800) 309-5450
  • Conference ID#: 91999104
  • Date: Thursday, October 13, 2016
  • Time: 6:00 - 7:30 p.m. EST
  • URL: http://epawebconferencing.acms.com/ceip/
  • Participant Dial-in Number: (800) 309-5450
  • Conference ID#: 92007237

After you click on the above URL, follow these steps:

  1. Click "Enter as a Guest"
  2. Type in your first & last name and organization
  3. Click "Enter Room"
  4. You will be in the room!
  5. Use the participant call in number and conference ID for audio

*Note: If you have never attended an Adobe Connect meeting before, test your connection by visiting https://epawebconferencing.acms.com/common/help/en/support/meeting_test.htm
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Agenda for EPA Round-Table Discussion for Environmental Justice Communities on the Benefits of Addressing Climate Change
item.description:
Agenda for EPA Round-Table Discussion for Environmental Justice Communities on the Benefits of Addressing Climate Change.  More information about the round-table discussion.

  • Agenda for EPA Round-Table Discussion for Environmental Justice Communities on the Benefits of Addressing Climate Change (PDF)(2 pp, 122 K, August 2, 2016)
  • Eco Cafe Participants (PDF)(3 pp, 103 K, August 2, 2016)
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: EPA Round-Table Discussion for Environmental Justice Communities on the Benefits of Addressing Climate Change
item.description:
On August 2, 2016, the U.S. EPA provided a round-table discussion for Environmental Justice Communities as an opportunity to share information, find common ground, work collaboratively with community groups, and acknowledge stakeholders’ perspectives on a variety of topics about President Obama’s Climate Action Plan and the Clean Power Plan. The day-long event was held at EPA's Region 5 office.

The objectives for this discussion included:

  • Explore benefits and opportunities for communities to address climate change.
  • Discuss economic and employment opportunities from energy efficiency and renewable energy programs.
  • Share community success stories and resources on the pathways to reduce carbon pollution.
  • Engage in dialogue with stakeholders to seek common ground in addressing climate change and the Clean Power Plan and Clean Energy Incentive Program.

Agenda and list of Eco Cafe participants

For more regulatory information:

  • Clean Energy Incentive Program
  • Clean Power Plan
item.dc:creator: jashley

item.title: Public Hearing on the Proposed Design Details for the Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP)
item.description:
EPA held a public hearing on the proposed design details for the optional Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP). In the final Clean Power Plan, EPA established the CEIP, which was designed to help states meet their goals under the plan by encouraging early investments in zero-emitting renewable energy generation, and by removing barriers to investment in energy efficiency and solar measures in low-income communities. The hearing was held on August 3, 2016 from 9:00 a.m. – 8:00 p.m. (CST).

  • Chicago, IL – Ralph Metcalfe Federal Building, Lake Michigan Room (12th floor), 77 West Jackson Boulevard, Chicago, IL  60604
  • CEIP Fact Sheet
item.dc:creator: jashley

item.title: CEIP Webinars - June and July 2016
item.description:
CEIP Design Details Proposal – Overview Webinars

EPA will hold webinars to provide an overview of the proposed Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP) Design Details Rule. The CEIP, which was included in the final Clean Power Plan, was designed to help states meet their goals under the plan by encouraging early investments in zero-emitting renewable energy generation, and by removing barriers to investment in energy efficiency and solar measures in low-income communities.

This proposal is an opportunity for stakeholders to provide further feedback on several key design elements including: clarifications about project eligibility, providing states with the flexibility to choose a definition of a low-income community, and how the matching pool should be made available.

During each webinar, EPA will provide a brief overview presentation about the proposed details of the Clean Energy Incentive Program and then will invite participants to ask questions.

Presentation slides are available on Proposed Rule About CEIP Design Details

Webinar Details:

Participants do not need to register in advance for the webinar. To participate* in a webinar, please click on the updated meeting link at the time and date that corresponds with your type of organization. https://epawebconferencing.acms.com/ceip/

The same meeting link is used for each webinar but the call in numbers are different for each webinar.   Audio for the webinar will be delivered through the phone line.

Please dial in 10 minutes before your call’s start time to ensure your participation.  See below for call and website details:

Time:                                       1:00 – 2:00 p.m. EDT
URL:                                         https://epawebconferencing.acms.com/ceip/
Participant Dial-in Number:         (800) 309-5450

Participant Dial-in Number:         (800) 309-5450

*Note: If you have never attended an Adobe Connect meeting before, test your connection by visiting https://epawebconferencing.acms.com/common/help/en/support/meeting_test.htm

item.title: Proposed Rule About CEIP Design Details
item.description:
On June 16, 2016, the EPA proposed certain design details for the optional Clean Energy Incentive Program (CEIP). Once finalized, the design elements in this proposal will help guide states and tribes that choose to participate in the CEIP when the Clean Power Plan becomes effective.

  • Proposed Rule (PDF)(44 pp, 611 K, About PDF) - Federal Register - June 30, 2016
  • Technical Support Documents
    • Community and Environmental Justice Considerations
    • Apportionment of the Matching Pool among the States
    • Renewable Energy and Low Income Energy Efficiency Potential
  • Notice: Extension of Comment Period (PDF) (2 pp, 101K, About PDF)
  • Public Hearing
  • Fact Sheet: Proposed Rule About Design Details of the CEIP (PDF)(5 pp, 141 K)
  • CEIP Design Details: Proposed State and Tribal Shares of Matching Pool (PDF)(3 pp, 92 K)
  • Webinar Presentation Slides - CEIP Design Details for State and Local Agencies (PDF)(19 pp, 358 K, June 2016)
  • Webinar Presentation Slides - CEIP Design Details for Communities and EJ Groups (PDF)(18 pp, 321 K, July 2016)
  • Webinar Presentation Slides - CEIP Design Details for Communities (PDF)(18 pp, 574 K, October 2016)
item.dc:creator: jashley

item.title: Carbon Pollution Standards Petitions for Reconsideration April 2016
item.description:
On April 29, 2016, EPA denied five petitions for reconsideration on the final Carbon Pollution Standards for New, Modified and Reconstructed Power Plants.

  • Federal Register Notice (PDF)(2 pp, 191 K, About PDF) - 81 FR 27442 published May 6, 2016
  • Basis for Denial of Petitions to Reconsider the CAA Section 111(b) Standards of Performance for Greenhouse Gas Emissions from New, Modified, and Reconstructed Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Utility Generating Units (PDF)(44 pp, 350 K)
item.dc:creator: rcopland
